comment.author: 32162360@N00
comment._content: What on earth is all the scaffolding for?  Is this when they were adding extra floors?

comment.author: 27331537@N06
comment._content: Yes, you can see more at the Sydney Architecture website which has a brief history of the building: "...Original building partially dismantled and rebuilt to three storeys with side wings, to form a U-shape in plan. 1896-1903" www.sydneyarchitecture.com/ROC/QUA05.htm AB

comment.author: 32162360@N00
comment._content:
The earlier building (James Barnett pre-1896) was much more attractive -  

[http://www.flickr.com/photos/powerhouse_museum/2362671311/]

comment.author: 29029178@N03
comment._content: Hi, I'm an admin for a group called Sydney's older buildings and structures. , and we'd love to have this added to the group!

comment.author: 63385174@N06
comment._content: This building had many alterations and additions over the years. Behind the columns on the lowest two floors are the original windows that date from the original bald-faced two storey building and exist today.
